paper_abstract: We derive the bias function that minimizes the statistical error of free energy differences calculated in work-biased fast-switching simulations. The optimum bias function is compared to other bias function using a particle pulled through a viscous fluid as an illustrative example. Our analysis indicates that the uncertainty in the free energy is smallest if both dominant and typical work values are sampled with high frequency. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Optimum bias for fast-switching free energy calculations
